website_summaries.verdict: Don't let the price fool you – these inserts are highly absorbent and with a bamboo charcoal outer layer, you can place them against baby’s skin or inside a pocket.
pros: Thick and absorbent enough to last through the night
Boasts a five-layer construction with bamboo on the outside and a microfiber inside
Machine washable and dryer safe on low
Dark colors makes staining less visible
cons: Can feel a bit warm in hot weather

customer_reviews.title: ONLY FOUR LAYERS!
customer_reviews.text: FOUR layers. Not five. FALSE ADVERTISEMENT. One of these began to unravel, so I decided to repurpose it. This is what I found. I'm not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Nina D.

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent and well made love them !!
customer_reviews.text: Theses are great I cloth diaper now 5 months and they are super absorbent. They wash very well too. I hang dry all my diaper stuff take about 9 hours to dry becouse they are so absorbent. But dry quickly in the dryer . I love them I'd say if you're not sure becouse they are a cheaper brand don't think anything about that they are very well made . 😊 all the Alva products are great and babygoal.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent, not super soft
customer_reviews.text: I love these liners, but I hesitate to give them a 5 rating. After 2 washes, their absorbency is anywhere from 8-12 hours a night. I use these with the Gerber pre-folds & plastic pants and have had no leaks since I began using them with my son, who is a heavy wetter. However, after only two washes & hanging to dry, the material started getting a pill-y appearance, which hasn’t seemed to impact the absorbency, but does bother me as the material isn’t as soft on baby’s bottom. Otherwise, I highly recommend these! The charcoal color has the added benefit of hiding stains better ;)
customer_reviews.author: Katerina

customer_reviews.title: so good! I have used alva bamboo inserts before (the ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I have used alva bamboo inserts before (the white ones), but these seem even more absorbent... time will tell. Currently I am using these for my toddler and the older inserts with my newborn. Big kid would soak thru the older inserts in less than 2 hours, and these are going easily 2+ hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: The best inserts among all that I've used...!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a LOT of different diapers to use with my first baby and i won't tell the whole long story but these are the only ones that I’m still using after 7 months of comparing every single type and style... I love them because (be careful this can be a little gross..) it absorbs sooo well the liquids that everything else stays on the surface and this makes cleaning so much easier!! No allergic reactions, no bad smells if cleaned properly. I’m really really happy, I would only purchase these if someone had explained all this to me a few months earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid Palacios

customer_reviews.title: I have used these for months now, everyday, ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for months now, everyday, and they have not let me or our baby down at all. They are very soft and wash clean easier than the cotton ones. They are manufactured at a very high quality. They are still holding up well after 5 months of use. Save some money on diapers, respect the environment, and buy clothe diapers and these inserts. Healthier for your babies skin too.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: The best liners
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite liners I’ve tried! I make sure to soak them in the bathtub full of water for at least 12 hours and wash them at least twice before I use them the first time But they are sooo absorbent and the best ones I’ve found for overnight (double-layered) We are cloth diapering for budget reasons and I’ve been slowly replacing all our liners with these.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Batura

customer_reviews.title: The best we've tried!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had gotten these first! I originally used charcoal/bamboo inserts with gussets.... don't bother with those, THESE are what's up! No gussets means easier to clean, plus your covers have gussets anyway. These are insanely soft and smooth, the poop basically slides right off when you rinse them with the sprayer. The absorbancy is fantastic (2y/o gets changed every 4 hrs and his skin is never left wet when I use these). We've tried 6 different types of inserts and these are by far our favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Insert, MUST PREWASH
customer_reviews.text: I use these with both Alva and BumGenius pockets. Our toddler is a medium wetter, some days heavy so I layer these with 1 microfiber insert as well and we’ve had no leaks that way. I dry them with everything else on a set cycle and they don’t require extra drying time. 4 stars instead of 5 for the inconvenience of pre-washing. These MUST be pre-washed several times; Mine went through 5 wash cycles before they could actually be used. I still liked them enough to order a second pack to replace some older inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Kallie

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for adult pads, cost effective
customer_reviews.text: This was used for bladder control . Would have been nice if it had a infitity type shape but have a really good review used as an adult pad. Caught standing bladder leak and barely any drip on underwear. Sold for baby control used for adult . Most underwear sold are sold as size 4x which is really a size 10 they run really small. This is an awesome alternative for pads sold as a pack of 12. So better then underwear sold as a pack of 4 for a couple of dollars more. They are easily washable . Will be ordering more. Thank you alvabady for making this available.
customer_reviews.author: ree

customer_reviews.title: Great inserts
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are amazing! I have stopped using the inserts that the cloth diapers came with and will only use these now. My 10 month old can go all night and not have a leak in these!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: These are so absorbent! I don't know if it's ...
customer_reviews.text: These are so absorbent! I don't know if it's these or the combination of these & the reusable diapers but my 2 1/2 yr old is very hot natured and when she's wearing her reusable diaper with this liner in it the whole area covered is so hot & sweaty. The liner is absorbing her sweat and I can't tell if it's sweat or a light pee, which is frustrating. I don't really know what to do to fix this issue. Obviously their doing their job, but she's too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have inserts
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. These are comfortable for my baby although they tend to make his diaper bulky. The awesome thing is that I do not have to change him in the middle of the night. They hold very well and I only need to change him in the mornings. I will be buying more as I am now hooked on cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good a little bulkier
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of Alva diapers, they are pretty good, but I have to buy different inserts because the microfiber kind are crap. For my 9 mo old daughter I can just use one insert and its fine. For my 2 year old boy, I have to double stuff inserts, one microfiber and one of these. I have bought these inserts and the other Alva white viscose bamboo inserts. I like the white kind better, they more absorbant and less bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Nessapier

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: My fourth cloth diapered baby is two months old and has been wearing these inserts for a little over a month now. They’ve been prepped, the pocket diapers fit well, but these inserts are just baffling to me why they don’t absorb well. They can’t possibly have buildup with a routine that I’ve happily used for three other babies with no issues, but I have more leaks with dry inserts than I can deal with!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Beck

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend these liners!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these liners back in June. Now in Oct. I do not use them anymore. Their ability to absorb has failed. I wash them, never use the dryer and they look very worn. There's a bad small that I can't seem to get rid of. These are not comparable to my other brand of liners. Not satisfied at all. Very disappointed, because I use and love Alva baby cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: patrice

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and soft. Have never worn out
customer_reviews.text: Love the material and they are very easy to clean and don’t get poop stains at all. Just don’t put diaper cream on them because the cream gets into the diaper and doesn’t come out for some reason. My baby has never had a rash but if she gets a little red I use the original diaper liners to put cream on, not these. But overall they are so soft and have never lost absorbency and they still feel like they felt the day I got them. My daughter is 9 months old
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing inserts
customer_reviews.text: I have cloth diapered for nearly a year now and I can not recommend these inserts enough! The absorbency is so much better than the white alvababy inserts that come with the cloth diapers , I tend to stack the white ones on top of these charcoal ones if we’re going to be out for a bit and they work awesome! Also because they’re black they don’t look nasty with stains after long time use
customer_reviews.author: Percilla Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Nice thick absorbant diaper inserts
customer_reviews.text: These diaper inserts are great for nighttime - extra thick to last longer. These are a little warmer, in the sense that I wouldn't use them on my son if we were outside or in warm weather, but I've been so pleased with how absorbant they are. These are great to keep my son sleeping longer before he notices a wet diaper!
customer_reviews.author: LGraham

customer_reviews.title: Almost just as absorbent as disposable diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I've used microfiber inserts, bamboo inserts, and now these and WOW! These are so absorbent!!! I change my toddler's diaper like 2-3 times a day and that is it. I almost gave up on cloth diapering because I grew tired of changing my boy's diaper every 1-2 hours. Now, I don't have to. I am even considering using these overnight (I still use disposable overnight just because they will always absorb the most). These are truly a game-changer in the game of cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: Christa C. Schlemmer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and helps with over night leaks
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts. Mostly due to others saying they smell after a bit of use. I had a mother tell me to use half a teaspoon of table salt in the washing machine when laundering to take care of the smell. It works!!!
customer_reviews.author: jewels

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent and Holds Up Well in the Wash
customer_reviews.text: These have worked great as a second stuffer for our toddler sized diapers (which I bought from Alva Baby’s website). They are extremely absorbent and have gone through the wash 20 or more times by now and are holding up strong. The stitching is good on the acctual insert. The only complaint I have are the tags are falling off because they were not sewn on very well, but those are not really needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Currier

customer_reviews.title: Alva is our favorite brand
customer_reviews.text: I use these sometimes instead of the regular microfiber inserts that came with our cloth diapers o also use them in addition to them. These work as well as any of the fancier,more expensive brands I have tried. They definitely give us a little extra time between changes and have prevented all leaking so far!
customer_reviews.author: MorganTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: These are not the greatest. I have all ALVA cloth diapers and love ...
customer_reviews.text: These are not the greatest. I have all ALVA cloth diapers and love them but these inserts were disappointing. They are not true bamboo material. They may contain trace amounts but they are mostly microfiber. They also hold smells in!!! Which is a HUGE downside. It must be the charcoal that holds the smells. I tried literally every method of cleaning and stripping these inserts and to no avail. They also came apart rather quickly. I had a subscription and they were delivered to me every other month and a new batch was much needed every time they came. I eventually found a new brand I like, but I would not recommend these to anyone. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M. Amezcua

customer_reviews.title: One of these > 2 microfibers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one pack of these to use with my pocket diapers and we preferred them over all of our other inserts so much that i just ordered another pack. One of these inserts lasts just as long as two microfiber inserts that come with Alva diapers. I love that we can just use one because my daughter is petite and doesn’t seem comfortable when her diapers are too “fluffy”.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Still some leaks but still pretty absorbent.
customer_reviews.text: I got these to double with the microfiber inserts that came with the Alvababy diapers. They work pretty well but I still get some leaks. Overall I would definitely say they have improved the absorbency of the diapers. I love that they are grey because then there are no stains. I also haven’t noticed any lingering smells.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Deckard

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent and perfect fit for pocket diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Forever wishing cloth was cheaper, but these are great!! Much more absorbent than the regular Alva bamboo inserts. We use 2 inserts at bedtime with no leaks with a heavy wetter! During the day, Just 1 insert is perfect as long as you keep up with changes. Easy to wash along with the other diapers, and fit well in all my pocket diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey S

customer_reviews.title: I pair these with a hemp insert and it still ...
customer_reviews.text: I pair these with a hemp insert and it still doesn't seem to last as long as if I paired the hemp insert with my cheap flour sack towels. The Alva tags are ripped off already and I've only washed them twice after prepping them in warm water and laundry soap for a day. I'm a huge fan of Alva baby just not these inserts, unfortunately!
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!!
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are awesome! They are very absorbant and pull all the moisture to the inside, when you pull them out of the diaper the outer layer barely feels wet. They are fairly bulky, which I don't think would be an issue with a bigger baby. I have to fold them down about a third to go in my 2 month old's diapers, so they are pretty bulky on him, but he is a really heavy wetter and I haven't had any leaks when using these inserts.
customer_reviews.author: M Sergent

customer_reviews.title: Help with the smell
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because the liners I use overnight for my daughter would smell bad in the morning. I use one of these liners plus a microfiber one and there is now no smell in the morning! Super absorbent, no leaks during the night and when I wash them they hold so much water.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea c.

customer_reviews.title: A MUST buy for cloth diapering
customer_reviews.text: These solved our problem of leaky diapers! (We do still change every 2-3 hours vs 4 hours with disposable). They are so much more absorbent than the liners that came with the Alvababy and Wegreeco diapers without being too much thicker. They are a must for anyone who uses cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: stop looking, BUY THESE!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite inserts! I love Alvababy. These work GREAT! BUY THEM!!! make sure you wash a few times prior to using. They are not super bulky in pocket diapers and absorb very well. Not to mention the price is awesome! I paid full price for these and will be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra D.

customer_reviews.title: Received a few days ago and started using. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Received a few days ago and started using. The stitching is already coming undone on this one and tags have fallen off. They seem to be absorbent though so hoping to have no further issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Max absorbency without the bulk
customer_reviews.text: Love these! My go-to insert. Much more absorbent than the microfiber inserts without being too bulky. Keeps my two month old dry for several hours
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Brown

customer_reviews.title: Quite Effective
customer_reviews.text: These are our favorite inserts so far, but we're only 2 weeks into our cloth diapering with our 3 week old. -The fact that the color doesn't show stains is the biggest plus for us. -Have not had any leaks yet. -Fabric is soft -Easy to clean -Quality/construction seems solid so far
customer_reviews.author: Quite Nicely

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Really like these, they wash well (warm water, heavy wash) and catch poop like a dream. I use them in an assortment of snap covers and they fit in all. Started using then when my baby was 2mos, he's now 5mo, and the gather makes them a bit shorter than flat inserts which I think fits better in smaller dipes. I use them during the day and use disposable at night (he hates feeling wet, which cloth diapers tend to feel since they don't have moisture wicking chemicals in them). He's very comfortable in them during the day.
customer_reviews.author: David Grigg

customer_reviews.title: BEST INSERTS
customer_reviews.text: My FAVORITE cloth diaper inserts! They stay soft and comfortable even after so many washes. I have Best Bottoms snap-in shells and inserts and Nora’s Nursery pocket diaper shells and inserts, and these work perfectly with both kinds.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Boarman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 12 of these for my Alva cloths. I washed them about 5 times in hot water to get the absorbency and after that they are great! I need to wash them about every two days and they hold alot!! I dont get a weird smell like some other brands. As long as you wash them correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Deziree H.

customer_reviews.title: At first I didn’t like the bulk, but...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got four different inserts, including OsoCozy prefolds, microfiber inserts, Buttons super soakers. These are by far my favorite! I use them in the Alva pocket diapers as well as covers and they work so well at absorbing. I’m thinking my newborn is a heavy wetter, which is why the others have not worked, but these have been fabulous! I’m ordering another set of them!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Lokemoen

customer_reviews.title: Been great for a heavy wetter
customer_reviews.text: They hold a ton of moisture. I've been using them with a flour sack towel in pocket diapers for my heavy wetter boy and they work great. He leaks out of a disposable within 2 hours during the day, but these can last 3 plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Liners for ALVABABY Pocket Diapers
customer_reviews.text: These are much better than the inserts that come with the ALVABABY pocket diapers. Not only do they hold more, they are also much softer, plus they are dark which means no visible staining. **Takes a few washes before full absorbency.
customer_reviews.author: kcotton4166

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I got these for nights time naps an out and about trips ! They work great alone an just as great with the original inserts that came in the diapers !! Will end up buying more as my baby gets older
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Bushek

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if we need to pay more for charcoal
customer_reviews.text: Not sure that there's a big enough difference between the charcoal and non-charcoal to pay more. We're fine with the microfiber.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Howard Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very nice insert. I use them in pocket diapers with hemp/cotton underneath. This has worked well. 2 of these inserts seem too bulky to me and don't absorb as well as the combo.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Feels dry
customer_reviews.text: I have a heavy wetter who doesnt cry when he pees. These are super absorbant and wick away moisture so babe doesnt get rashes or discomfort from being wet. These are great for overnights and heavy wetters
customer_reviews.author: Lhardy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: Fit for my 16 month old perfectly, i was afraid they’d be too small. Love the dark color, doesnt show any stains. Very absorbent. We are working on potty training and i cant even tell if they are wet or not half the time. I dont put them in a pocket, i just lay them on the liner.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Not as absorbent as my other liners. I have stripped them over and over and I thought with them being charcoal , they would smell the least, but they always have this weird smell to them. Not terrible, but I wouldn’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: These work pretty well for the price, I do notice leaks occasionally with this if they get kind of bundled up in the pocket diapers .
customer_reviews.author: Danny Olivas

customer_reviews.title: Longer wear time!
customer_reviews.text: Very absorbing, the charcoal bamboo doesn’t squeeze out as easy as the micro fiber when the baby is sleeping. Longer wear time is also helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Monahan

customer_reviews.title: ... time I am trying cloth diapering and I really like the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I am trying cloth diapering and I really like the price, and the color because I wouldn't able to get past continual use if they stained because of my OCD of being cleaned. They seem super absorbent so far, I have been using them for about 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: Hayes Tribe

customer_reviews.title: My whole stash is made up of these
customer_reviews.text: I bought two packs just cause it was a good deal but they are so good I've bought two more packs since then! No smell, easy clean and haven't lost their shape after being washed so often!
customer_reviews.author: adarrow

customer_reviews.title: Great Value w/ Subscibe & Save
customer_reviews.text: These are a fair price.. and a good product and with the subscribe and save option a great value! Ive washed and dried several times and they have not curled up or warped.
customer_reviews.author: NaomiPlus5

customer_reviews.title: Tell your mama friends!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best and most absorbent nappy inserts!!! I've used several kinds and stopped once I found these. 4 layers is great, 5 is even better!! I also have a heavy wetter. These are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Great insert option
customer_reviews.text: It’s our first time cloth diaper and it was nice to have an option for an insert that wasn’t white. These inserts don’t show stains, clean easily and absorption well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Super absorbent, but I still double layer because my 19 month old pees a lot. Lol. Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon

customer_reviews.title: In addition to original cotton
customer_reviews.text: They work! My 1 year old out grew our original insert set. I combine these with the original cotton ones. Fewer leaks = less laundry= happy mom!
customer_reviews.author: Moira S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for night
customer_reviews.text: These are super absorbent compared to the microfiber inserts that come with most diapers so glad I finally gave them a try!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Walker

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy anything else!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. So easy to clean, very difficult to stain, and they’re extremely soft. Just buy these inserts and no other. One goes in the pocket and one in the diaper and it works ALL NIGHT LONG, even for the heaviest of wetters.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No leaks!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler has started to leak through the microfiber inserts we were using. We switched to these a few weeks ago and not a single leak since!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, holds up overtime super absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Love these inserts. We double them for overnights. And i use 1 for long drives. They hold up really really well over time. 2 years in on our first set and they havent had smells or needed to be stripped. Just bought 2 more packs to have extra with a new baby coming. We use them in Alvas.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Slove

customer_reviews.title: Get them!
customer_reviews.text: My absolute favorite inserts. They're super absorbent, easy to clean, and seem to be holding up the best out of all my inserts. Compared to Nora's Nursery bamboo, fluffy penguin bamboo, alva microfiber, and fluffy penguin charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: marti rothlisberger

customer_reviews.title: I’m not very happy with these diaper inserts I’ve read that you need ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m not very happy with these diaper inserts I’ve read that you need to wash them multiple times before they’re absorbable which pretty much sucks . I’ve washed them multiple times and they still leak ,my daughter still gets soaking wet And I wish I never bought them. If i could give them zero stars I would
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Really good . I am new to clothe dipers so the only one I’ve tried was microfiber inserts that came with dipers, this product is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I I'd like the ones that curve in the middle but these work way better and prevent leaks. Dont show any stains and are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Merrick

customer_reviews.title: They are getting better, just not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how many washings you have to do before they start absorbing, but I've probably done 20+ washings so far. They are getting better, just not what I was expecting. The company should pre wash them, so they are absorbing properly when you get them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of use these are still working great. On my 15 months baby i put one carbon bamboo and a 3 layer microfiber and works great for 2 and a half - 3 hours. I don't leave diapers longer because he gets rashes, so 3 hours top is fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: JORGE V.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these, they leak
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy these... low absorbency, even with two of these lines my little one will soak through them during her nap. I have other bamboo lines that are much better
customer_reviews.author: cd2187

customer_reviews.title: Fresh out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet, but look good fresh out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for wet diapers
customer_reviews.text: Not as absorbent as the ones that came with our diapers but good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE! We have a heavy wetter and the micro fiber weren't cutting it. These are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklynne Bone

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I use mostly mama koala and Alva products. These are great, they don’t have snaps so I use them in addition to my liners with snaps for extra absorbency for bed time. I haven’t had a single leak since I starting pairing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbyythegreat

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbant! Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very good at absorbing. Easy to use and love for night time use. Doesn’t cause rashes or any skin issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon P

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to wash and really absorbent! We use them overnight and rarely ever have any leaks. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Amazing absorption! I will buy again for sure
customer_reviews.text: Amazing absorption! I will buy again for sure. My first time buying these online and I can honestly say it was a success.
customer_reviews.author: Kia

customer_reviews.title: I love Alva brand for disposable diapers
customer_reviews.text: I love Alva brand for disposable diapers, the dark color liner is. I've because they do not stain as easily as the white liners!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a heavy wetter... not bulky.
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Very absorbent! I replaced all my microfiber inserts with these! They're fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Wells

customer_reviews.title: LOOOOVE
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great product I love them more than the bum genius brand
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: I double up on these inserts for my three year ...
customer_reviews.text: I double up on these inserts for my three year old In a Kawaii baby pocket diaper for overnights. Work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike DG

customer_reviews.title: Keeps baby dry through the night
customer_reviews.text: Stopped overnight soaking. I was stuffing several of the regular inserts without improvement. This keeps him very dry all night.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Lott

customer_reviews.title: Best inserts I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best inserts I've ever used! They absorb so well, I don't ever have to double up with these ones like I do my bamboo and microfiber ones. I wish I knew about these with my first born!
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: Great liners, much better than microfiber.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant, very absorbent, much more so than the microfiber ones that come with a lot of cloth nappies. We've used them for about 4 months so far and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great inserts
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. They are incredibly absorbent and they are super gentle on my baby's tush. I lay them in my pocket diapers instead of putting them in the actual pocket as I feel it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole H

customer_reviews.title: The stitching has come loose
customer_reviews.text: The stitching has come loose on a couple of Inserts and the inner layers are coming out a little. It will make them useless after a few wash cycles. I just hope it doesn't happen with the rest of the inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I use them with my son’s Alvababy diapers. They absorb very well. I change a diaper every 3-4 hours
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and very absorbent. I use two in my diapers and never have leaks or blow outs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing, I love them and definitely buying more! They are thin, lightweight, super absorbent and not so bulky! My baby sleeps between 8-10hrs and one liner does him perfect, would recommend two liners for the heavy wetters though. These are absolutely worth the money and very happy with my purchase, I definitely recommend these!☺
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My personal Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Great absorbancy. Priced right. Soft and comfortable. My babies are happy
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Very absorbent and fits my pocket diapers and diaper covers. (LLB and babygoal brands)
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Quality questionable
customer_reviews.text: They hold the urine well, just not overly happy about the fact that after washing them the first time they had a lot of strings hanging from then and a few looked like they were going to separate very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Just microiber and compression leaks
customer_reviews.text: These are just microfiber inserts masked. They are not good and almost always result in a compression leak.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: No overflow
customer_reviews.text: I love these. We make sure these are the inserts in the night time diaper, and we haven't had overflow since. They're great!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I like these inserts. Only thing I dislike is they are definitely more microfiber than bamboo. I can tell a huge difference between these and my bamboo inserts from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Fraley

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. They're very absorbent, thick, great quality, and for a fair price 👍
customer_reviews.author: Lori Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. They are bulkier than any of my other inserts and I just packed them away
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M.

customer_reviews.title: These have been my favorite liner. Super absorbant and haven't had any issues ...
customer_reviews.text: These have been my favorite liner. Super absorbant and haven't had any issues with smell!! We have been using them with the Alva pocket diapers and they work perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Made well and absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Some other reviews said these had seam rips or random strings. Mine do not, they are sewn well and are absorbent. Our little guy is quite the heavy wetter!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean and absorbs very well also helps cut down on the pee smell
customer_reviews.author: Tangerine Munro

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! The are absorbent, do not show stains, and are less bulky than the liners that came with my diapers.
customer_reviews.author: New Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not absorbent at all!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t absorb anything :( am really disappointed in these. I’ve washed them countless times to try and get them to absorb anything but zero change. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: These liners are very absorbent and great at keeping the baby dry. They are very easy to rinse off and the darker color makes it so they do not stain.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Adams

product_meta.title: AlVABABY Charcoal Bamboo Inserts,Cloth Diaper Liner,5-Layer Inserts,Reusable Liners for Baby Cloth Diapers 12pcs 12ZTN
feature_bullets: FITS BABIES OF ALL SIZES – Dimension of bamboo charcoal insert:33cm in length(12.99'') *13.5cm in width are designed to fit all one-size pocket diapers or cover diapers/

SAVE MONEY & ECO-FRIENDLY – Our reusable bamboo charcoal insert are designed for families who require premium products.These diaper inserts are reusable and fully machine washable, dryable,fast to dry. Super water absorbent/
HIGN QUALITY– 5 layers design , the outside 2 layers are bamboo charcoal, the inside 3 layers are microfiber. This makes it super absorbent/
5-LAYERS – 5 Layers bamboo charcoal insert. It is 5 times than normal material terry towel/
SINCERE SERVICE & NO RISK － 1 year guarantee. If you have any problems with the product, please feel free to contact us, we’ll send you a new one or refund your money of your choice/
